Comparing (5) and (7), observe that t ⋛ RSIR t , stÖGÜ⋛ It Intuitively, the standard SIR model assumes a uniform chance of infection for each suscepti- ble agent which is proportional to the population infection rate It N. In contrast, in the network- augmented NSIR model an individual's chance of infection is heterogeneous and is a function of the social network G.
